label: Stations
subtitle: List stations seismic INGV
description:
This endpoint retrieves information about all seismic monitoring stations available in the TerraQuake API. It provides users with detailed metadata on each station, including its network code, site name, geographic coordinates (latitude and longitude), elevation, operational status, and start date.

These stations are part of the seismic monitoring network used to detect and record earthquake events in real time.

Query Parameters:

- limit: (Optional) The number of stations to return per page. Defaults to 50 if not specified.
- page: (Optional) The page number of the results to retrieve. Defaults to 1 if not specified.

label: Code Station
subtitle: By code station
description:
This endpoint retrieves detailed information for a specific seismic monitoring station, identified by its unique station code.

It returns station metadata such as network, site name, geographic coordinates, elevation, and operational period.

Query Parameters:

- code: (Required) The station code to search for (case-insensitive).

label: GeoJSON
subtitle: Full station dataset (GeoJSON format)
description:
This endpoint retrieves the complete list of seismic monitoring stations in GeoJSON format.

It is primarily intended for mapping, GIS visualization, and geospatial applications. Each feature includes coordinates (latitude, longitude, elevation) and station metadata such as network, site name, and operational status.

Supports optional pagination using `limit` and `page`.

label: Status: Open
subtitle: List of active seismic stations
description:
This endpoint returns all seismic monitoring stations that are currently operational (active/open).

It provides station metadata including network code, station name, geographic coordinates, elevation, and operational status.

Useful for monitoring the active seismic network, real-time data acquisition systems, and observatory dashboards.

Supports optional pagination with `limit` and `page`.

label: Status: Closed
subtitle: List of inactive or decommissioned seismic stations
description:
This endpoint returns seismic monitoring stations that are currently not operational (closed/restricted).

It provides metadata such as network code, station name, location coordinates, elevation, and deactivation details.

Useful for historical research, network maintenance planning, infrastructure audits, and understanding changes in seismic network coverage.

Supports optional pagination with `limit` and `page`.

label: Network Statistics
subtitle: Seismic network summary
description:
This endpoint provides a summary of the seismic monitoring network, returning the total number of stations along with how many are currently operational (open) and how many are inactive or restricted (closed).

Useful for dashboards, network health monitoring, performance analytics, transparency reporting, and historical comparisons of network size and operational status.
